item.title: Toxic Developers Destroy Productivity
item.description: If you are the leader of a software team, then you have heard of the legendary 10x developer - the superstar worker. To improve your team's productivity, learn this: replacing an average worker with a superstar worker is not nearly as effective as removing a toxic worker. It’s not even close. Toxic workers destroy productivity.

item.title: Tip: Stop Solving Your Team's Problems
item.description: If you lead a software team, and a team member has a problem, you may be tempted to solve it. Maybe you shouldn’t. This is an opportunity for more than a solved problem.

item.title: Tip: They Don't Have to Like You
item.description: Are you a software leader worried that the team members don’t like you? You can stop worrying. They don’t have to like you. They just have to trust you.

item.title: Tip: Coaching Means Giving Less Advice
item.description: A tip for software team leaders: coaching well means giving less advice.

item.title: Tip: Negotiate Achievable Goals
item.description: Leaders must ensure that the software team's goals are achievable.

item.title: Tip: Routinely Develop Your Influence
item.description: On a software team, leaders should make the development of social influence routine.
